# aahutil
Scream into the void, programmatically

## Arguments 
  -a string
    	a string (default "A")
  -an int
    	an int (default 42)
  -h string
    	a string (default "H")
  -hn int
    	an int (default 3)
  -n	a bool (default true)
  -u string
    	extra string
  -x string
    	extra string
  -xn int
    	extra int (default 1)

## Example

./ahutil -an 500 -hn 0 -x '!!! I WROTE A THING'
!!! I WROTE A THING

## Bugs

Screaming into the void should not be neccessary. And yet...
